gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency
Class MarkerOverlay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.OverlayJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.MarkerOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IOverlay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class MarkerOverlay
extends OverlayJPanel

This class allows a user to place markers near a region on a view component. Since this class extends an OverlayJPanel, which extends a JPanel, this class is already serializable.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

MARKERS

public static final java.lang.String MARKERS
"Markers" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the markers created by this marker overlay. The value that this key references is a Vector of Markers.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EDITOR_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String EDITOR_BOUNDS
"Editor Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the size and bounds of the Marker Editor window. The value that this key references is a Rectangle. The Rectangle contains the dimensions for the editor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

state - - ObjectState this overlay is being set to.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in class OverlayJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

addMarker

public void addMarker(int type,
                      floatPoint2D[] locations,
                      java.awt.Color color,
                      float radius,
                      int behave_on_zoom)
Add a marker to the MarkerOverlay to be shown on the display.

Parameters:
type - The type of marker to be used.
locations - The locations of the markers in world coordinates.
color - The color of the marker(s) being added.
radius - The radius of the circle circumscribing the marker in world coordinates.
behave_on_zoom - How the cursor reacts to zooming, either resizes or maintains the same size.

addMarker

public void addMarker(Marker marker)
Add a marker to the MarkerOverlay to be shown on the display. An advantage to using this method is that the marker class has a constructor to allow creation of one marker without putting its location into an array.

Parameters:
marker - The marker to be displayed.

removeMarker

public void removeMarker(Marker marker)
Remove the given marker from the list of markers. If the marker is not in the list, nothing will be done.

Parameters:
marker - The marker to be removed.

removeMarker

public void removeMarker(int index)
Remove the marker at the given index. If negative one (-1) is passed in, the last marker will be removed. Invalid indices will be ignored.

Parameters:
index - Index of the marker to be removed. The first index is zero.

clearMarkers

public void clearMarkers()
Allows toplevel components to remove all markers.

setAllMarkerColor

public void setAllMarkerColor(java.awt.Color color)
This method sets the color of all the markers. Initially set to black.

Parameters:
color -

editMarker

public void editMarker()
This method is used to view an instance of the Marker Editor.

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in class OverlayJPanel

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Overrides paint method. This method will paint the markers.

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - - graphics object

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
For testing purposes only.
